text: get ready chicken finger fans I have a
really fun idea for you there chicken
fingers that are coated in corn
tortillas instead of breadcrumbs crunchy
delicious corn tortillas I'm making
basically what amounts to bread crumbs
out of corn tortillas tear 10 6-inch
corn tortillas into pieces and then put
them directly into a food processor add
a little bit of salt and pepper and then
grind up into crumbs the exact same way
that you make breadcrumbs they're ground
up
so that's your coating I have some flour
here I'm going to add a little bit of
salt and pepper to my flour because I
like to season all the layers of my
fingers whisk it around a little bit I
have a quarter cup of flour in here a
cup of buttermilk in this pie plate and
then my ground-up corn tortillas in this
one I'm going to line them up in order
when you're dredging it's flour to dry
off your ingredient some kind of
moisture in order to make whatever you
want to coat it in stick and then the
coating get a nice coating on there and
then just transfer to a clean tray I
like to try to do this without using my
fingers so they don't get chickeny
fingers but honestly I do think that the
best tool for this job is your fingers
but then they get all chickeny and then
coated in buttermilk ii crumbs I'll cut
it up and ready to fry two fry them heat
about two inches of oil a neutral
flavored oil something good for frying
peanut oil is fantastic if you're not
allergic to peanuts some kind of great
canola oil and heat it to about 350
degrees you'll want to leave plenty of
room in the pan so that they fry evenly
so you'll probably want to fry your
chicken and batches and you just fry
these till they're golden brown and cook
through it can take up to 12 minutes but
give them a check every once in a while
and make sure that they're cooking
evenly you might need to turn them over
to entertain yourself while you're
waiting for your chicken fingers to fry
you can make a little sauce if you want
to I'm making a honey mustard sauce so I
have three tablespoons of honey three
tablespoons of mustard and well that's
it
that's the sauce these would also be
good dipped in some salsa if you wanted
to if you like a little bit of spice or
with good old ketchup there you go these
are looking really good beautiful and
golden you want to transfer them
immediately to a paper towel to drain
and those look absolutely fantastic add
batches to the pan as you remove them I
cannot wait to try these I'm going to

they're incredible I'm going to keep
